intro: Eriolobus, commonly known as the false thistle, is a genus of flowering plants in the Asteraceae family. These plants are characterized by their spiny leaves and composite flower heads, which consist of both ray and disk florets. They are typically found in arid or semi-arid regions, thriving in well-drained soils. The genus includes several species, some of which are used in traditional medicine. Eriolobus plants play a role in local ecosystems by providing food and habitat for various insects and animals.
